results.title: The Shot
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Isaacs, Peter Delfgou and Dan Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.
This film on shot put shows how muscular force should be applied through the body to the shot. It demonstrates training and warm up procedures which should be used prior to the competition throw. From the series “Athletic training”.

results.title: The Short game in golf
results.brief_description: Golfer Tommy Armour demonstrates different styles, grips, and techniques in putting, and displays his techniques for making short, accurate shots when approaching the green. Shows how to extricate the ball from a sand trap. Slow motion photography is used in showing the stance and the swing.

results.title: The Shoplifter
results.creator_credit: Highway Safety Foundation and Herbert J. Leder
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how petty thieves work in shops, and how retail staff can best deal with them. Gives many examples of how petty thieves work in shops, their various techniques and the variety of equipment used to steal all types of goods. Explains the many ways in which a retail store and its staff can best deal with shoplifters through layout of a store, the display of goods and the training and alertness of staff.

results.title: The shooting. Ride in the whirlwind
results.creator_credit: Proteus Films, Jack Nicholson and Monte Hellman
results.brief_description: Features two avante-garde western classics. “Ride in the whirlwind”: Three innocent cowboys are mistaken for outlaws when they find themselves caught in an ambush at the hideout of a gang of stagecoach robbers. They are forced to flee with a posse on their heels, unable to prove their innocence. Although the film is faded, this rough, low budget western is a must for Nicholson fans. “The shooting”: An ex-bounty hunter is hired by a girl with no name. They are followed by a cold-blooded gunslinger. There is a harsh relentless edge to this eerie and obscure tale. Nicholson’s famous “slow-burn” performance is matched with a fine supporting cast including Millie Perkins and Warren Oates.

results.title: The Shooting gallery (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Zdenek Bumba, Sim Productions, Kratky Film, Sim Productions (U S) and Miroslav Stepanek
results.brief_description: Mechanical targets in a shooting gallery are the protagonists in this allegory about the repression about freedom and the destruction of love. The film is a springboard for thought and discussion about political, social and interpersonal relationships. Animation by Stana Prochazkova.

results.title: The Shoemaker and the hatter
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and John Halas
results.brief_description: This film presents, in the form of a fable, a defence of free trade. The hatter and the shoemaker are neighbours; the hatter makes one hat which he intends to sell at a high price; he secures a ban on the importation of hats. The shoemaker, on the contrary, believes in mass-production, but finds that trade restrictions and tariff barriers prevent him from paying with shoes for the machinery he has acquired from a neighbouring country. In his travels, he discovers that each country is unable to sell what it produces to buy what it needs. Thanks to his initiative, action is taken to bring this state of affairs to an end, and the result is general prosperity.

results.title: The Shoemaker and the elves
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: The story of th elves who slip into his shop and make shoes for the shoemaker is retold with animated puppets. This charming film, based on a Grimm fairytale, tells what happens when the shoemaker and his wife leave new clothes, food and sweets for the elves one night.

results.title: The Shock of the New Series
results.creator_credit: Lorna Pegram, David Richardson, RM Productions, Time-Life Films and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: In this series, art critic and writer Robert Hughes outlines a social history of the development of the visual arts in the 20th century. In each episode, Hughes examines the forces which influenced the directions painting, architecture and photography took from the late 1800’s to the present.

results.title: The Shirley Temple collector's classic
results.brief_description: A collection of film excerpts and short films starring Hollywood’s favourite child actor, Shirley Temple. The four short films are interspersed with scenes from “The Little princess”. Quality is inconsistent and there is no narration or introduction.
